solution_line_template: John is half times his father's age. Thus {john_age_fraction}*{father_age} = <<{john_age_fraction}*{father_age}={john_age}>>{john_age} years.

Since the mother is {age_difference_father_mother} years younger than the father, she is {father_age}-{age_difference_father_mother}= <<{father_age}-{age_difference_father_mother}={mother_age}>>{mother_age} years old.
The age difference between John and his mother is {mother_age}-{john_age} = <<{mother_age}-{john_age}={age_difference_john_mother}>>{age_difference_john_mother} years
